page.title: 01Sea Loch Striven
page.content: {Climate}(a) Rainfall 2000-2200mm per annum. Rain all year, but with more during late summer and winter than during spring and early summer. (b) warm wet lowland to cool wet foothill and upland moderately exposed with moderate winters.{Geology. Daldradian mixed Quartzose and Micaceous Schists. Psammites occur as thick bands of Schistose grit. {Soils.}Brown earths and peaty gleys. Poor Ground conditions. Rough ground. Steep slopes. F.R. 114.{Vegetation. Dense Bracken and grass mixtures on lower slopes changing to Calluna-Vaccinium mixture on the uplands. Below 300m commercial forestry plantations. Above 300m extensive sheep grazing.
